Posts.Content: Aug 23, 2008 03:12PM Lynette wrote: Thank you so much for your generosity in reassuring me and giving me support. You are absolutely right when you say that any little twinge feels significant. My doctor tells me that I'm just anxious but that's easy to say. Take care and thank you.
Posts.Title: Signs of mets.. Lynette heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: Lynette wrote: I was told (about nearly 2 months after my lumpectomy and axilary node clearance) that I should be massaging the scars - especially the axillary node clearance scar otherwise the healing tissue could attach to my ribs as there isn't much tissue underneath (which was taken out with the nodes), and cause tightness. I'm annoyed that they didn't tell me earlier as there is already tightness and my the skin surrounding my scar does feel as though it's stuck underneath and not as moveable. I know this is the least of my worries but it makes me feel sick to think that my skin could be 'stuck' to my ribs underneath! My says I'm still in the early stages of healing and that my skin shouldn't be stuck now but it's definitely stiff. Has anybody experienced this sort of advice/problem? Thanks in advance for your replies. Dx 7/30/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage II, Grade 1, 1/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Skin mets or insect bites? Lynette ozzie2

Posts.Content: Lynette wrote: Hi everyone, I had the first FEC last Tuesday. Went home feeling a little rough but not wanting vomit. Had a rest for a few hours and fell way behind on my 10 prescription medicines. Consequetntly, for the rest of Tuesday and Wednesday 5 was unable to eat nor drink and vomitted bile for the whole of the two days. We contacted the emergency numbers and whisked staright into The Royal Marsden in Sutton London which is a speialist hospoital. I was put back on track with IVs  and I am eating a drinking normally onlly (some foods). I cannot bear water or tea which I love. I can only stomach pineapple, tropical juice, blackcurrecnt etc. I came ou tof hospital yestaerday (Sunday) and feel extrememly tired but can at least eat and drink. Next time they'll prepare me better and I will make a greater chance to stay on top of the medications as some I take at 8.00am, others at 12.00md ,4.00pm, others at 6.00pm and others at 8.00pm I seem to be clock watching all the time. The dexa tablets which are steroids affect my faculties and this has taken me a lot longer to write than I would normnally take.  Best wishes and cake care, Lynette  Dx 7/30/2008, IDC, 3cm, Stage II, Grade 1, 1/16 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My first FEC.... Lynette bettysgirl

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2008 06:03PM Lynette wrote: Dear everyone thanks so much for your kind help. Apparently the scans are 'fuzzy' and they can't easily distinguish between one thing or another. How can they be so sure then that someone has bone mets or doesn't have bone mets. I've had an aches in my lower back and left hip for as long as I can remember and years ago, the doctors didn't investigate any further. My pain hasn't been severe though and comes and goes depending on how much activity I do. I love walking and though exercise was good for the bones but I have weaara and tear in my hips (according to the bone scan last month) and obviously it's done me no good. The scan also revealed mild scoliosis which my mother also has (apparently it can sometimes be genetic. However, wear and tear is the least of my worries and I'm just relieved that my hot spots aren't anything else although I know bone mets are quite easily cured. Regards. Lynette.
